result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan W. Seese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Not to use a belt as a form of discipline.
Not to engage in any corporal discipline.
Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or any other family member.

records.addlTxt:
Treatment letters and certificates, received and filed in court by Atty. Lavoy.
To be sealed per Judge Dreyfus.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Bryan W. Seese in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
WITHHELD SENTENCE;

Term of Probation:  9 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
Not to use a belt as a form of discipline. 
Defendant not to engage in any corporal punishment.
Domestic Violence or Anger Management Counseling and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
No violent contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint or any other family member.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Regarding Use of DVD Statements signed and filed.
Stipulation and Order regarding Use of DVD Statement(s) received by State.
Defendant's Supplemental Demand for Discovery filed by Attorney LaVoy.
Defendant to have no violent contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Bryan W. Seese in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
